info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 1:13PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A moderate band of snow will impact portions of southeastern Lewis and Clark, northwestern Meagher, northwestern Judith Basin, southwestern Chouteau and Cascade Counties through 145 PM MST... At 111 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking moderate snow showers along a line extending from 11 miles west of Highwood to 12 miles southwest of Great Falls to 6 miles northwest of Wolf Creek. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Brief period of moderate snow. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Variable visibility down to a quarter mile or less and slippery roads could result in hazardous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Cascade, Belt, Black Eagle, Wolf Creek, Highwood, Portage, Eden, Sluice Boxes State Park, Malmstrom Afb, Stockett, Tracy, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Centerville, Tower Rock State Park, Shonkin, Craig, Armington, Ulm and Canyon Creek. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 210 and 285. Highway 200 between mile markers 0 and 7. Highway 287 between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
